headline: Creamy Broccoli Salad
description: Broccoli, bacon, and mozzarella cheese are tossed in a creamy dressing for a perfect picnic salad.
name: Creamy Broccoli Salad
recipeIngredient: 1 pound fresh broccoli, cut into florets

recipeInstructions.text: Place bacon in a large skillet and cook over medium-high heat, turning occasionally, until evenly browned, about 10 minutes. Drain bacon slices on paper towels; crumble when cooled.
Mix bacon, broccoli, onion, and mozzarella cheese in a bowl.
Whisk mayonnaise, sugar, and vinegar in a small bowl until sugar dissolves and dressing is smooth; pour over broccoli mixture. Toss to coat.

review.reviewBody: Yummy I ran out of mayo after a 1/4 cup added a poppyseed dressing to make up to 1/2 cup.. absolutely delicious
So good! All ingredients create a perfectly delicious way to eat your broccoli.
Super easy and always a big hit!!!
The combination of flavors is wonderful. Easy to make and great dish to take for a party.

This is a wonderful way to get everyone in the family to eat their vegetables, even those who don't like broccoli. I did make a few adjustments. I doubled the recipe so my adjustments are also doubled. I used organic raw apple cider vinegar, 3 tablespoons. I also added 1\2 teaspoon of dry mustard and 1\8 cup milk. My adjustments made the dressing a little thinner because the original recipe was a bit to thick. Using organic raw apple cider vinegar and increasing the amount by adding another tablespoon and the addition of the dry mustard made for a for a slightly more complex flavor. I air fried the bacon to reduce the total fat. Overall the family gave it 2 thumbs up!
Delicious, but eat it within two days as it gets soggy.
Simple and delicious; even my picky husband liked it and said Yes to make it again
This is a great dish! Very tasty! I also added golden raisins and sweet dried cranberries! Instead of mozzarella cheese I put cheddar cheese! Will definitely put this in my favorites
Delicious and easy to prepare! I added craisins and sunflower seeds. My husband wanted to eat the whole bowl all by himself!!
Awesome
Very tasty broccoli salad. I cut the sugar by a tiny bit and used rice wine vinegar ( because thatâ€™s what I had.)
I didn't have any mozzarella cheese, but it was delicious without.

This recipe is super easy to make and tastes amazing! I added some of my own little tastes and they do not take from the original recipe at all! I added red cabbage, carrot, changed out the cheese for Tex-mex, added 1tbsp minced garlic and used lemon juice instead of vinegar. So, so, so yummy!

This is great recipe. I did not add the cheese. I have lost a lot of weight and try to cut were I can. I also used Monk Fruit instead of sugar. Can't tell. I added a few tablespoons of water after I tossed the dressing to thin it out as I added chopped chicken to it and I wanted a little taste on that as well. I added dried cranberries (I love the tart). I agree, let it sit for a few hours by making this ahead of time. Thanks for a great recipe!!

Great recipe.. I love a plain broccoli salad, I think nuts and dried fruit and stuff people add detract from the simple perfection. I personally use cheddar & double the onion for personal preference.. I do recommend using sugar to taste, definitely a crowd pleaser. I could eat the whole bowl!
It was great but we made it more amazing by topping it with toasted chopped hazelnuts with butter! Mmmmmmmm

Excellent basic broccoli salad recipe, you can also add pretty much anything that sounds good to you. I add thinly sliced radishes, definitely more broccoli, some pine nuts (or whatever nut you like for a little extra texture), and I like the 6cheese finely grated Italian mix. Be sure to mix sugar & vinegar first, after melded, then mix in with the mayonnaise. Always gets raves and requests for the recipe.
Doesn't need the sugar. I chopped up the brocolli florets and left the sugar out. Everyone loved it.

Fabulous! Just like the deli! I followed it as is. I added sunflower seeds because I like them in the store bought I get. I like this better because I made it fresh. I let it sit for about 4 hours...it did take the bite out of the onions. Good suggestion. Thanks for this wonderful recipe!!
Very good. I cut back on ingredients to make a smaller salad. Easy to make.

I have made a similar recipe where you have to cook the dressing and then let it cool etc. This version is so much easier and quicker, but just as good. I didn't have any mozzarella cheese, so substituted a grated cheddar blend. It was a nice color contrast to the broccoli. Very tasty!
I added a little Cesar dressing to the mix. Yummy!

I could not find the recipe Tossed Broccoli Salad by Nina Pitcl. I printed it years ago and need a clean copy. By doubling this recipe and substituting 1/2 lb of bacon, 1/2 of a red onion and cider vinegar I was able to replicate the recipe.
I have made this many times. Even better the next day.
It is a wonderful dish. I think including dried cranberries and sunflower seeds would make it a bit more complete.
This is just what I needed in my life! Added tomatoes, small cubes of sharp cheddar cheese, and had a fork full of creamy goodness. Thanks for sharing.

I am sorry I ever found this recipe.

The first time I made it, I took it to work for a pot luck. Now this is all they ever want me to bring.

So much for taking a bag of chips or some buns. That will never happen again.

My bowl is almost always the only one that's empty, and I at least double the recipe.
I love this recipe! Sometimes I will add red globe grapes or Craisins for a little more color and a nice, surprising sweetness.
Great recipe, have made it a few times & it's always been a hit! I used aged cheddar instead of mozzarella because it's what I had in the fridge & it was still fantastic.

Excellent!!! I have made this several times for parties and have come home empty! No leftovers. Only thing I don't add is the onions I also have used fresh mozzarella cheese in the past but the shredded works great too! Great ANYTIME salad.
Best broccoli salad EVER!! I like to shred some of the broccoli and add to the mix as well. I've been making this at least once a week since I found this recipe. My 2 year old LOVES it too!!!

I omitted the sugar and instead used one packet of Truvia. I did add a few spices to the dressing to jazz it up a bit (dill weed, dried chives, onion/garlic powder, celery salt, little hot sauce, fresh ground pepper). Very nice broccoli salad. The longer it sits, the better it gets.

I love broccoli salad but have never had it with Mozzarella cheese, gives a nice mild creaminess to the salad. I used part skim Moz. and an 8oz. chunk shredded yielded about a cup and half of cheese. I had two heads of broccoli, so not sure if that was a pound or not. The dressing was pretty good and not as vinegary as other dressings tend to be, I just added the sugar until it reached my sweet preference, just a bit under the amount called for, and I added in a few grinds of black pepper. I've learned over the years when you make a broccoli salad, make it several hours before serving so the broccoli has time to absorb the dressing, the longer the better, if you want crispy bacon just wait and toss it in later. This salad is good enough for company and will be in my recipe box.
